@graph.name: Sweet Potato Muffins with Blueberries - Vegan Heaven
@graph.description: These sweet potato muffins with blueberries are super healthy, sweet, extremely moist, incredibly easy to make, and of course vegan!

@graph.headline: Sweet Potato Muffins with Blueberries
@graph.keywords: baking with sweet potato,breakfast muffins,coconut whipped cream,easy vegan muffins,healthy muffins,healthy vegan muffins,how to make coconut whipped cream,mashed sweet potato muffins,potato muffins,recipe for sweet potato muffins,sweet potato muffin recipe,sweet potato muffins,sweet potato muffins healthy,vegan sweet potato muffins,yam muffins

@graph.name: Sweet Potato Muffins with Blueberries
@graph.description: These sweet potato muffins with blueberries are super healthy, sweet, extremely moist, incredibly easy to make, and of course vegan!
recipeIngredient: 2 1/2 heaped cups sweet potatoes, peeled and cut into small pieces
3/4 cup almond milk or other plant-based milk
1 1/2 cups spelt flour ((whole wheat flour is fine as well))
1/2 cup brown sugar or coconut sugar

recipeInstructions.text: In a medium pot, bring some water to a boil and cook the sweet potatoes until they're fork tender. This will take about 10 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: In a medium pot, bring some water to a boil and cook the sweet potatoes until they're fork tender. This will take about 10 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Drain and place them together with the almond milk into a food processor and blend until smooth.
recipeInstructions.name: Drain and place them together with the almond milk into a food processor and blend until smooth.

recipeInstructions.text: In a medium bowl, combine the flour, the sugar, the baking powder, the vanilla, the cinnamon, and the salt and add the sweet potato mixture. Stir with a wooden spoon until combined.
recipeInstructions.name: In a medium bowl, combine the flour, the sugar, the baking powder, the vanilla, the cinnamon, and the salt and add the sweet potato mixture. Stir with a wooden spoon until combined.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the blueberries and use a spatula or spoon to gently fold the blueberries into the sweet potato muffin batter. Bake at 350 °F for about 25-30 minutes depending on your oven.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the blueberries and use a spatula or spoon to gently fold the blueberries into the sweet potato muffin batter. Bake at 350 °F for about 25-30 minutes depending on your oven.

recipeInstructions.text: Let them cool down for about half an hour and serve them with homemade coconut whipped cream (instructions in the text above) and fresh berries. Enjoy!
recipeInstructions.name: Let them cool down for about half an hour and serve them with homemade coconut whipped cream (instructions in the text above) and fresh berries. Enjoy!
